Definition.WordDefinition: Hat Chald. karb'ela, (Dan. 3:21), properly mantle or pallium. The Revised Version renders it "tunic."

Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
hat
A common (spoken) name for the circumflex ("^", ASCII 94) character.
See {ASCII} for other synonyms.
[{Jargon File}]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44
The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Hat \Hat\, sing. pres. of {Hote} to be called. Cf. {Hatte}. [Obs.] ``That one hat abstinence.'' --Piers Plowman. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Hat \Hat\ (h[a^]t), n. [AS. h[ae]t, h[ae]tt; akin to Dan. hat, Sw. hatt, Icel. hattr a hat, h["o]ttr hood, D. hoed hat, G. hut, OHG. huot, and prob. to L. cassis helmet. [root]13. Cf. {Hood}.] A covering for the head; esp., one with a crown and brim, made of various materials, and worn by men or women for protecting the head from the sun or weather, or for ornament. [1913 Webster]
{Hat block}, a block on which hats are formed or dressed.
{To pass around the hat}, to take up a collection of voluntary contributions, which are often received in a hat. [Colloq.] --Lowell. [1913 Webster]
hat n. Common (spoken) name for the circumflex (`^', ASCII 1011110) character. See {ASCII} for other synonyms.

Dictionary.Name: Virtual Entity of Relevant Acronyms (Version 1.9, June 2002)

Definition.WordDefinition: hat n 1: headdress that protects the head from bad weather; has shaped crown and usually a brim [syn: {chapeau}, {lid}] 2: an informal term for a person's role; "he took off his politician's hat and talked frankly" v 1: put on or wear a hat; "He was unsuitably hatted" 2: furnish with a hat [also: {hatting}, {hatted}]
